title: Spacecoco: Retro-cartoon neon visual/audio upgrade, animated start/menu presentation, and competitive scoring/elimination revamp

requirements.text: Upgrade the Spacecoco start experience (Home screen + Lobby screen) to a high-motion, retro-cartoon neon presentation: add an animated hero/splash scene with UFOs/aliens flying across the screen and bright cows firing eye-lasers, while keeping the game name and core navigation intact.

quotes: ensure the start screen has lots of movement ,the main menu should be bright Aliens and ufos flying all over the screen ,cows shooting laser from their eyes very bright ,retro cartoon 4k high quality

acceptanceCriteria: Home screen and/or Lobby screen includes a clearly animated scene (not just a static image) featuring moving UFO/alien elements and cow eye-laser effects.
All user-facing text remains in English (existing headings/buttons remain understandable and consistent).
Navigation to Lobby/Play/Skins/Leaderboard continues to work as before.

requirements.text: Revamp the in-game scoring UI (HUD) to a modern arcade retro-neon style with large digits, bright neon color accents (purple/red/blue/green as primary palette), and high-clarity readability over gameplay.

quotes: for the scoring system, big numbers neon retro that when you open the game you say wow
change the scoring system ... more modern and entertaining with bright colors and numerations that make sense with the game mechanics

acceptanceCriteria: Score and Level are displayed with larger, more prominent typography than the current HUD.
HUD styling is neon/retro and uses the requested bright palette (including purple/red/blue/green).
HUD remains readable against the playfield (no low-contrast text over bright effects).

requirements.text: Implement an updated competitive scoring model that awards points when the snake eats objects and when it successfully eliminates an opponent, with on-screen score feedback (e.g., floating neon number popups) that clearly communicates how many points were gained.

quotes: improve the scoring structure so the snake increases score when it eats objects or kills one of its opponents
more modern and entertaining ... with bright colors and numerations that have sense with the mechanics

acceptanceCriteria: Eating at least cows and penguins changes the score in a clearly visible way (HUD updates and an on-canvas or overlay popup appears).
When an elimination event occurs (see competitive rule requirement), the winner receives a clear points reward and an on-screen popup indicates the gain.
Score feedback animations do not block gameplay visibility (brief duration, positioned sensibly).

requirements.text: Add the competitive elimination rule: when a snake hits an opponent's head with its body, the opponent resets back to the normal starting size, and the winner can collect dropped point items to gain score and grow.

quotes: the main theme should be competition ... the one who hits with the body on the head of their opponent eliminates it and can eat its points and grow more
when that happens the losing snake starts at its normal size while the remaining one eats the points that were left

acceptanceCriteria: A head-vs-body collision between two snakes triggers an elimination event for the head owner (not a full match reset).
The eliminated snake respawns/resets to the normal starting size as defined by the game initialization rules.
The elimination produces collectible point items on the playfield, and collecting them increases the winner's score and causes additional growth.

requirements.text: Increase perceived visual quality during gameplay using web-feasible rendering techniques without changing the core rules: add a brighter, more 'expensive' neon look via post-processing-like effects (e.g., glow/bloom styling, laser trails, subtle motion blur/trailing) while preserving gameplay readability and performance.

quotes: just improve it ... make the game very bright and the best visible possible
use option one only improve it
make it look like it was made by the best game company

acceptanceCriteria: Lasers have a visible trailing/glow effect compared to the current thin beam rendering.
Overall gameplay presentation is noticeably brighter/neon without obscuring hazards, snake, or collectibles.
Game remains responsive (no obvious stutter introduced by the new effects) and core mechanics remain intact.

requirements.text: Upgrade audio polish using web-feasible techniques: replace or improve SFX to higher-quality versions and add stronger gameplay feedback (e.g., stereo/spatial feel, filters/ducking where appropriate), while keeping mute behavior working on the Play screen.

quotes: add better sounds ... as technical and playable as possible
laser that whistles behind, explosions with low-pass ... strong bass

acceptanceCriteria: The existing mute toggle on PlayPage continues to mute both music and SFX.
Laser firing and cow-eating SFX are upgraded in quality and remain clearly audible with appropriate mixing.

At least one additional cinematic-feel audio enhancement is present (e.g., positional panning on laser, filtered explosion tail, or dynamic volume shaping) without breaking browser autoplay constraints.

requirements.text: Generate and include new high-quality retro-cartoon neon static art assets and sprite sheets needed for the updated start/menu presentation and brighter in-game VFX, placed under frontend/public/assets/generated and loaded directly by the frontend (no backend image serving).

quotes: also change the presentation so the image is cooler and more detailed with ufos and bright cows being attacked by laser

acceptanceCriteria: New images/sprite sheets are present under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced via correct absolute paths (e.g., /assets/generated/...).
The start/menu presentation uses the newly generated assets (not placeholders).
No backend endpoints are introduced for serving images.

constraints: Do not change the game name (“Spacecoco”).
Do not remove existing gameplay systems (planets/modifiers, bosses, UFO/cow spawning, crocodiles, power-ups); changes must be additive or compatible with current loop.
Keep all user-facing UI text in English.
Use only web-feasible rendering/audio approaches (no Vulkan, native ray tracing, HDR10, or other non-browser tech).

Do not edit files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or anything under frontend/src/components/ui (compose instead).
nonGoals: Implement Vulkan-based particles or native GPU ray tracing.
Introduce external databases or non-Internet-Computer backend services.
Add third-party authentication beyond Internet Identity.

required: Retro-cartoon neon splash/hero illustration with UFOs, aliens, bright cows, and eye-laser action (spacecoco-splash-neon.dim_3840x2160.png)
Wide retro-cartoon neon banner scene with UFO flyovers and laser chaos (spacecoco-menu-banner-neon.dim_2560x900.png)
Sprite sheet of multiple UFO/alien fly-by frames for menu animation (spacecoco-menu-ufo-sprites.dim_1024x256.png)
Sprite sheet of bright cow eye-laser firing frames for menu animation (spacecoco-menu-cow-laser-sprites.dim_1024x256.png)
Neon glow particle/spark spritesheet for UI/VFX accents (spacecoco-neon-sparks-sprites.dim_512x512.png)
edits: Increase detail/contrast and shift to high-quality retro-cartoon neon look with brighter UFO/cow/laser elements (spacecoco-hero.dim_1600x600.png > spacecoco-hero-neon-cartoon.dim_1600x600.png)

preferencesToAdd: Prefer a very bright, retro-cartoon neon visual style with purple/red/blue/green accents and high-motion animated start/menu screens.
